channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024110499
item.description:
Report X-2024110499

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-02
  • City: MONROE TOWNSHIP
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A SPILL WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER ON THE FLOOR OF A TRAILER PARKED ON DOOR 2 OF THE UNLOAD AREA. A HAZMAT RESPONDER WAS IMMEDIATELY CALLED, IDENTIFIED THE SPILL AS HYDROCHLORIC ACID BASED ON PACKAGE MARKINGS, AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE SOURCE OF THE LEAK WAS DISCOVERED TO BE A PUNCTURE ALONG THE SEAM OF ONE OF THE PLASTIC CONTAINERS.

item.description:
Report E-2024110231

  • City: WESTAMPTON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHILE UNLOADING FREIGHT FROM TRAILER MATERIAL HANDLER DISCOVERD A BOX LEAKING FROM BEING CRUSHED BY OTHER FREIGHT WHEN ORIGINALLY LOADED. SPILLED MATERIAL WAS NEUTRALIZED AND CLEANED WITH ABSORBENT AND PLACED INTO A RECOVERY CONTAINER AS WAS THE CRUSH BOX.

item.title: Report E-2024110222
item.description:
Report E-2024110222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-28
  • City: CRANBURY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and concrete terminal floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released due to the battery overturning during transit. Clean Harbors personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used a granular absorbent to recover the spent material. The spent absorbents were containerized into six (6) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste were transported to a nearby ESTES terminal. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110166
item.description:
Report E-2024110166

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-30
  • City: KEARNY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 30, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of tea tree oil was punctured and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the tea tree oil-impacted loading dock floor. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon overpack and all impacted waste and absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for future disposal.
